snippet: Judges already have the authority to make frivolous litigants pay for their abusive lawsuits. They just have to use it.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Federal Judge Randall R Rader and law Profs Colleen V Chien and David Hricik calls for legislation that curbs activities of so-called 'patent trolls,' who buy up patents and then sue anyone and everyone who might be using or selling claimed inventions; contends practice has clogged the judicial system and has slowed development of new products.

byline.original: By RANDALL R. RADER, COLLEEN V. CHIEN and DAVID HRICIK

lead_paragraph: Judges already have the authority to make frivolous litigants pay for their abusive lawsuits. They just have to use it.

headline.seo: Make Patent Trolls Pay in Court
